result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Medina-Muniz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martin Medina-Muniz in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez.  BRANCH 4 FOR BRANCH 21. Case in court for jury trial. State moves to amend count 1 to DISORDERLY CONDUCT (DOMESTIC ABUSE ASSESSMENTS), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1) and 973.055 (1),  a Class B Misdemeanor. On motion of the state, Court orders COUNT 1 amended to: DISORDERLY CONDUCT (DOMESTIC ABUSE ASSESSMENTS), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1) and 973.055 (1),  a Class B Misdemeanor. Defense and defendant are in agreement. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Pay supervision fees.

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 

State request restitution hearing. Court grants request.

Received and filed: 
Victim Impact Statement,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 

Restitution hearing and Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 4.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 2, 2018 at 01:30 pm.  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 04.
